snippet: New-car registrations in the European Union were down 6 percent in June compared with a year earlier and were running at their slowest pace since 1996.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column observes new-car registrations in the European Union were down 6 percent in June compared with a year earlier and were running at their slowest pace since 1996; notes American new-car sales have been recovering.
lead_paragraph: New-car registrations in the European Union were down 6 percent in June compared with a year earlier and were running at their slowest pace since 1996.

headline.print_headline: New-Car Salesmen Are Lonely in Europe
headline.main: New-Car Salesmen Are Lonely in Europe
